intro: Thalictrum pumilum, commonly known as the dwarf meadow rue, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring slender, branching stems covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in compound umbels, which bloom in early spring. Its leaves are compound, with multiple pairs of oval, pointed leaflets, giving it a delicate appearance. Thalictrum pumilum thrives in moist, shady woodlands and is often found in moist meadows and streambanks.
